page.title: 08Kirkcaldy High School
page.content: The school has 1690 pupils and 121 teachers. The average number of pupils in a class is 31 although the classes in practical subjects are under 20. The Rector thinks the standard of behaviour is quite good but is gradually getting worse with many cases of bullying. In general the pupils get on well with the Staff. The first punishment is the issuing of a yellow sheet on which something has to be written. The school is well equipped with many computers and a great deal of the administration is computerised. The school is well situated in the middle of its catchment area although on a busy road. The first and second years are in a separate building half a mile from the Senior building which means that Staff have to travel back and forward.
